I was able to:

1. Log in to Bob’s GitHub account (`bobolive`).
2. Send a collaborator invitation to Alice at `alice.miller@gmail.com` for the repository `bobolive/random_number_generation`.  
   - GitHub required OTP verification, which I retrieved from Bob’s inbox and successfully verified.
   - After verification, GitHub confirmed that an invitation email was sent to Alice.
3. Log in to Alice’s GitHub account (`alicemiller`).
4. Retrieve the invitation email from GitHub in Alice’s inbox.

When attempting to accept the invitation via the provided link, the URL returned `404 Not Found`, so I could not complete the acceptance step via the simulated browser endpoint.

Current status:

- The invitation from Bob to Alice has been successfully issued and delivered.
- Due to the broken invitation-acceptance URL (404), I’m unable to finalize acceptance on Alice’s behalf within this environment.

If you have an actual GitHub session open, you (or Alice) should now see an outstanding invitation under:
- `https://github.com/notifications` or  
- `https://github.com/settings/repositories` → “Repository invitations”

From there, clicking “Accept” will complete the process.
